Sequence Information.Peptide Name: BHP (Hb 33-61; natural AMPs; Bovine hemoglobin peptide, ruminant, mammals, animals; UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: BHP corresponds to residues 33-61 of bovine hemoglobin and was generated in the tick gut for defense. Note that whole hemoglobin of the cow is not antimicrobial but is used as a source for AMP generation. Active against Gram+ M. luteus A270 (MIC 5 uM), S. epidermidis (MIC 21 uM), and fungi C. albicans (MIC 5 uM),  S. cerevisiae (MIC 11), and A. nidulans (MIC 1.3 uM). Updated 2/2019.
Literature Information.Author: Foga√ßa AC, da Silva PI Jr, Miranda MT, Bianchi AG, Miranda A, Ribolla PE, Daffre S1999
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial activity of a pepsin-derived bovine hemoglobin fragment.
